oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Japanese Gardens in Centennial Park, Nashville, Tennessee, 1931
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A postcard of the Japanese Gardens in Nashville’s Centennial Park, in 1931. The verso of the postcard states; "A statue of Buddha, quaint bridges and a grotto create a beauty spot distinctively Japanese. Flower gardens, playgrounds, tennis courts, etc., make this 134-acre 'show park' particularly interesting. Hilltop affords view of city." Forms part of the Ridley Wills II Nashville Postcards Collection. 1 postcard.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wills, Ridley, 1934-
